00031 #include <stdio.h>
00032 #include <stdlib.h>
00033 #include "spiceweasel.h"
00034 
00035 #define IPXGLOBALORIGIN
00036 #include "io_ipx.h"
00037 
00038 TRawFrame readraw;  /* Temporary storage for reading */
00039 
00040 void read_init()
00041 {
00042   readraw.allocated = 0;
00043 
00044   if(input_format == FORMAT_IPX) {
00045     /* IPX - one file containing all images */
00046     printf("Reading IPX file %s...", input_template);
00047     fflush(stdout);
00048     if(IPX_read_open(input_template, &ipx_read_status)) {
00049       printf("failed!\n");
00050       exit(1);
00051     }
00052     printf("done\n");
00053   }
00054 }
00055 
00056 void read_finish()
00057 {
00058   if(input_format == FORMAT_IPX) {
00059     IPX_read_close(&ipx_read_status);
00060   }
00061 }
00062 
00063 int read_frame(int number, TFrame *frame)
00064 {
00065   char filename[MAX_NAME_LEN];
00066   int errcode;
00067   int i, j;
00068   float factor;
00069 
00070   frame->time = 0.0;
00071 
00072   if(input_format == FORMAT_IPX) { /* IPX VIDEO FORMAT */
00073     /* IPX code reads in a single frame and converts to floats */
00074     if(IPX_read_frame(number, frame, &ipx_read_status)) {
00075       printf("Error: Could not read frame %d from IPX file %s\n", number, input_template);
00076       exit(1);
00077     }
00078     
00079   }else { /* A SET OF FRAME STILLS */
00080 
00081     /* Get the filename */
00082     sprintf(filename, input_template, number);
00083 
00084     /* Read the data in raw format */
00085 
00086     errcode = 0;
00087     switch(input_format) {
00088     case FORMAT_BMP: {
00089       errcode = read_bmp(filename, &readraw);
00090       break;
00091     }
00092     case FORMAT_PNG: {
00093       errcode = read_png(filename, &readraw);
00094       break;
00095     }
00096     default: {
00097       errcode = IO_ERROR_FORMAT;
00098     }
00099     }
00100     
00101     /* Check error code */
00102     
00103     if(errcode) {
00104       switch(errcode) {
00105       case IO_ERROR_OPEN: {
00106         printf("Error: Could not open input file %s\n", filename);
00107         break;
00108       }
00109       case IO_ERROR_FORMAT: {
00110         printf("Error: Input file %s has an invalid file format\n", filename);
00111         break;
00112       }
00113       case IO_ERROR_SIZE: {
00114         printf("Error: Size of frame %s different to previous frames\n", filename);
00115         break;
00116       }
00117       case IO_ERROR_OTHER: {
00118         printf("Error: Could not read input file %s\n", filename);
00119         break;
00120       }
00121       }
00122       exit(1);
00123     }
00124     
00125     /* Check/Allocate the frame */
00126 
00127     /* Check if the frame has been allocated */
00128     if(frame->allocated) {
00129       /* Data already allocated - check same size */
00130       if((frame->width != readraw.width) || (frame->height != readraw.height)) {
00131         /* This should never happen - checked already */
00132         printf("\n====== OUT OF CHEESE ERROR =========\n");
00133         exit(1);
00134       }
00135       
00136     }else {
00137       /* Allocate memory. Note organised in COLUMNS */
00138       frame->data = (float**) malloc(sizeof(float*)*readraw.width);
00139       for(i=0;i!=readraw.width;i++)
00140         frame->data[i] = (float*) malloc(sizeof(float)*readraw.height);
00141       frame->width = readraw.width;
00142       frame->height = readraw.height;
00143       frame->allocated =  1;
00144     }
00145 
00146     /* Change the data to be floating point between 0 and 1 */
00147     
00148     factor = (float) ((1 << readraw.bpp) - 1) ;
00149   
00150     if(readraw.channels != 1) {
00151       /* Input frame is in color */
00152       if(readraw.bpp > 8) {
00153         printf("\nSorry: Cannot read color images with bpp > 8 yet\n");
00154         exit(1);
00155       }else {
00156         /* Convert red channel */
00157         for(i=0;i<frame->width;i++) {
00158           for(j=0;j<frame->height;j++) {
00159             frame->data[i][j] = ((float) readraw.data[j][readraw.channels*i]) / factor;
00160           }
00161         }
00162       }
00163     }else {
00164       /* Greyscale image */
00165       if(readraw.bpp > 16) {
00166         printf("\nSorry: Cannot read greyscale images > 16bpp yet\n");
00167         exit(1);
00168       }else if(readraw.bpp > 8) {
00169         /* Data has 2 bytes per pixel */
00170         for(i=0;i<frame->width;i++) {
00171           for(j=0;j<frame->height;j++) {
00172             frame->data[i][j] = ( 256.0*((float) readraw.data[j][2*i]) + 
00173                                   ((float) readraw.data[j][2*i+1]) ) / factor;
00174           }
00175         }
00176       }else {
00177         /* if less than 8 bit, data must be unpacked into one byte per pixel */
00178         for(i=0;i<frame->width;i++) {
00179           for(j=0;j<frame->height;j++) {
00180             frame->data[i][j] = ((float) readraw.data[j][i]) / factor;
00181           }
00182         }
00183       }
00184     }
00185   }
00186 
00187   frame->number = number;
00188   
00189   return(0);
00190 }
